source: V.A. Kostelecký, N. Russell, J.D. Tasson, 'Constraints on Torsion from Bounds on Lorentz Violation', Phys. Rev. Lett. 100, 111102 (2008), arXiv:0712.4393. Eq. (6) gives best component-wise sensitivities for minimal coupling.
note: This table contains vetted component-wise bounds for the axial torsion vector A_μ in the Sun-centered celestial-equatorial frame (T,X,Y,Z), under the one-component-at-a-time assumption used for Table I / Eq. (6) in the reference.

mapping.description: Minimal-coupling mapping used by Kostelecký–Russell–Tasson: b_μ ≃ -(3/4) A_μ (all other torsion couplings set to zero).
mapping.note: From arXiv:0712.4393 Eq. (3) and the statement 'minimal coupling is recovered for ξ4^(4)=3/4 with other couplings zero' (page 2). Sign is irrelevant for absolute bounds.
